prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0878, 0.0]. This will establish the orientation and position of the part. Create a new sketch on face_1. Draw a circle with its center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. Now, extrude the sketch along the normal axis by 0.0439 units. Set the opposite normal extrusion depth to 0 to maintain a solid body. Apply a sketch scale of 0.75 to maintain dimensional consistency. Since this is the first part in the assembly, no previous parts are present to interact with, so simply confirm the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" flag. The resulting part is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The height is 0.75 units, the width is 0.0439 units, and the length is 0.75 units. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Middle and Smooth Shape Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0922, 0.0439, 0.0922]. This will establish the correct orientation and position for the part to intersect with existing parts. Create a new sketch on face_1. Draw a circle with its center at [0.2828, 0.2828] and a radius of 0.2828. Extrude the sketch along the normal axis by 0.0439 units and apply a sketch scale of 0.5655. The opposite normal extrusion depth should remain 0. Set the "JoinFeatureOperation" flag to allow the new part to merge seamlessly with any existing parts, creating a smooth, rounded shape. The resulting part is a cylindrical object with a tapered middle section and smooth round edges. The height is 0.5655 units, the width is 0.0439 units, and the length is 0.5655 units. This part is joined with the previous part by merging their cross-sections.</description>
